Key Match Events: Billy Cook made a Clemente-like throw in the third inning to nab Tommy Pham.
Cook scored from first base on an Isiah Kiner-Falefa base hit in the fifth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Pirates were wearing 21 as a tribute to Roberto Clemente on his day.
The number 21 was stenciled into the grass at Cook's position in right field.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Derek Shelton praised Cook's play, saying he 'plays fast' and 'is not timid about anything he does.'
Cook credited his parents and grandfather for instilling in him the mindset of playing hard and fast.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cook's throw and run were vital in the Pirates' 4-3 win over the Royals.
The Pirates acquired Cook at the Trade Deadline from the Orioles in exchange for Minor League pitcher Patrick Reilly.
Others: Cook has only been up in the Major Leagues for eight days but has shown a knack for being at the center of the big plays.
The game was played on Roberto Clemente Day, and Cook felt a sense of pride and tribute playing in right field wearing the number 21.
